data.title: PHP Snippets are not being summoned by IntelliSense
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:38:28.425Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 14.5.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.6.2|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.3.8|
|toml|be5invis|0.0.3|
|LogFileHighlighter|emilast|1.0.1|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|0.0.12|
|Theme-MaterialKit|ms-vscode|0.1.1|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.20.4|
|pasteandformat|spoeken|0.0.5|
|Align|steve8708|0.2.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|1.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a custom PHP Snippet.
2. Create a new PHP file, or edit an existing one.
3. Try to invoke a snippet using its prefix.
4. Press <kbd>⌘</kbd>+<kbd>Space</kbd>.
5. Your custom snippet is not showing in the list.

data.title: Title Bar not functional - clicks through to desktop
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code


![weird-title-bar-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/286972/21229410/7e98d19e-c2af-11e6-8d67-e2d1d05d3b18.PNG)

![weird-title-bar-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/286972/21229414/816619ea-c2af-11e6-8b81-26e72986604f.PNG)

There's a black bar doubling the size of the title bar. The title bar doesn't respond to any clicks, nor does the black bar. All clicks go straight through to the desktop. You can see the result of right-clicking in the second image - it's right-clicking the Recycle Bin icon. I can also launch applications by double-clicking where their icon is positioned.

Have tried:
- launching with extensions disabled
- uninstalling/reinstalling VS Code

data.title: code formatting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|nativescript|Telerik|0.5.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:
I just updated to the latest version of vscode (1.8) today.

When I formatted (Alt + Shift + F) code for a .html page,
the results were **unexpected**, not properly aligned, and 
**not** the behavior of code formatting prior to 1.8.

The .html page is a part of an ionic 2 project and so has 
ionic 2 components along with typical html elements such as `<div>`.

data.title: Error formatting code when using inline style atributtes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0 (38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d, 2016-12-13T17:45:32.595Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|swagger-viewer|Arjun|1.2.0|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.2.0|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.4.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. produce HTML code
2. \t < table class="info-obj bottom" style="border-top: 0">
    \t\t\t\t(not indent) <tr *ngIf="response">
3. use shortcut: { "key": "shift+alt+f", "command": "editor.action.formatDocument", "when": "editorHasDocumentFormattingProvider && editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly" },

Expect: 
\t < table class="info-obj bottom" style="border-top: 0">
\t\t(cool format) <tr *ngIf="response">

Actual Result:
\t < table class="info-obj bottom" style="border-top: 0">
(no tabs/spaces) <tr *ngIf="response">

data.title: Font ligatures not working properly with C and C++ syntax highlighting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7, 1.8, insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10, Arch Linux x64

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set font to **"Fira Code"** (or any similar font which uses programming ligatures).
2. Enable ligatures with `"editor.fontLigatures": true`.
3. Write code for a lambda with trailing return type or a `->` access to a method.
4. The ligatures are not expanded correctly *(see screenshot below)*.

![incorrect ligatures with C++ syntax highlighting](http://i.imgur.com/BfAZujZ.png)

---

Setting the syntax to **"Plain Text"** makes the ligatures work correctly.

![correct ligatures with Plain Text syntax highlighting](http://i.imgur.com/kXMJc1J.png)

---

*(This also applies to other ligatures, not only `->`.)*

*(This also applies to C syntax highlighting.)*

data.title: Question: Can I debbug Electron renderer process multi window at the same time?
Error when running type 'node2' in vscode 1.8

- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none

launch.json
```
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "node",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
    },
    {
      "type": "node2",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "node2",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"

}
```

app.js
```
let msg = "Hello World !";
console.log(msg);
```

```
node --nolazy app.js
```

data.title: Misleading statement in tooltip for CSS margin attribute
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  
  Version 1.8.0
Commit 38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d
Date 2016-12-13T18:03:00.506Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version:  
  Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
Release:        16.04
Codename:       xenial

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new CSS file
2. Define a selector with margin
3. Rollover margin attribute oder value until tooltip appears
4. Tooltips states that the “value may not be negative”

![tooltip_001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16631/21225287/75db4c0a-c2d0-11e6-88b8-715c311c8494.png)

From the [W3C recommendation](https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/box.html):

> Negative values for margin properties are allowed, but there may be implementation-specific limits.

data.title: Debugger stops at random paths, without being able to see the stack
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

See image -
when hovering at top of stack trace, tooltip shows debugger is stopped at weird path "1003/619".
I'm running in context of co with support of generator promises, might have to do with the problem.
Didn't happen before version 1.8.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make sure debugger is node2
2. step into a generator function
3. debugger should stop at some weird path

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19211868/21224942/3488ada4-c2d7-11e6-82ff-f0f57154f463.png)

data.title: Notify user of background jobs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Linux

![img](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7603482/21224422/cb47af54-c2d4-11e6-8d66-3fb18021b6a2.jpg)
There are 3 things that I want to point out:
  1. For new user and old as well, it will be great if there was a better and easier way to display that vscode is doing something in the background and you should wait a bit. And not only that, there are times when it isn't red and I see vscode with 100% process usage and have no idea what is he trying to do. Being red means that there is a problem.

  2. When i see it red, I click it to get more info.. what i get is select between linux/win/mac ?! I believe that some improvements will be needed for this, cause this is confusing

  3. It is a bit related to the 1-st point. It would be great if there was a shortcut to Developer Tools->Console . My point is that if the user has a problem, it should have a fast way to find out what it is. The information displayed in the console (log) should be for normal users as well and not only vscode developers. I only found out that you can view this log after 2 months and it would have helped a lot if it was somewhere more obvious/intuitive for normal users.

data.title: Difference in debug console output when running and debugging launch configuration
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.9.0-insider
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.11

Steps to Reproduce:

1: Have the following launch configuration set up which start a flask server:

```json
        {
            "name": "Server",
            "type": "python",
            "request": "launch",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "pythonPath": "${config.python.pythonPath}",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/flask/run.py",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "internalConsoleOptions": "openOnSessionStart",
            "debugOptions": [
                "WaitOnAbnormalExit",
                "WaitOnNormalExit",
                "RedirectOutput"
            ]
        }
```

1.  Run the launch configuration with command `workbench.action.debug.run`.
2. See all the output in the debug console that you would see in a normal shell.
3. Start a debugging session with command `workbench.action.debug.start`.
4. Only seeing some (every other) line that is otherwise visible when *running* the configuration just before as it starts up, and things logged to stdout as the python script is running, and is outputtet when *running* the configuration or in a shell, is also not outputtet in debug mode as the script continues running at all.

How come the output in debug mode is not the same as in run mode?

data.title: Document hint in VS Code shows HTML tags
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 64bit 1511

We noticed a *visual* issue with documentation tooltip when hovering the mouse on an API from RxJs library. Then created an issue [over there](https://github.com/ReactiveX/rxjs/issues/2197): outcome is that document format respects JSDoc standard, so now it's more a question of whether VS Code should fully support JSDoc or what.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. have an Angular 2 / TypeScript 2 web application with a dependency on RxJs (5.0.0-rc.1)
1. open it in Visual Studio Code, v1.8.0
1. reach for an `Observable<>.do()` invocation
1. hover mouse to show documentation tooltip

Here's a screenshot showing the unexpected tags:

![vscode-jsdoc-rxjs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3185573/21224286/c1688a3e-c2cb-11e6-82fe-78593f8623d5.png)

data.title: Zen mode should center page content or have configurable margins in percent of viewing area
data.body:
The purpose of Zen mode is to get rid of all distractions and make it easy to read/write/scroll through code (most often a single file). Sadly without centering on large screens the current implementation is not fulfilling that purpose for me. 

It is not adding a margin or centering the defined number of columns on screen or inside the tab area thus I have to constantly turn my head left to read. 

On my 30 Inch main monitor this is how zen mode can be configured to look in Sublime:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/231889/21224091/bcd51a7e-c2ca-11e6-90ef-3eaf0b03d32c.png)

this is it under vs code

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/231889/21224127/db754d32-c2ca-11e6-9a00-a96adb11876f.png)

PS: Keep up the good work :) great editor all in all.

data.title: Suggestion: Expandable objects in the debug console
data.body: While going through release notes for VS Code 1.8 I came across [this enhancement](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15796) and thought that it would be really handy if the same would work for objects sent by PowerShell script to the standard output (pipeline) and possibly even for Verbose and Debug channels. What do you think?

data.title: JSON parsing doesn't like URLs, affects formatting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607 (14393.576)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Load a JSON file that has a URL in single quotes. The file starts off in red but then turns green at the // in the URL.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1979931/21223068/3c040f66-c2bd-11e6-9eb1-63b0d7de3fe0.png)

2.  If you go right-click, Format Document, the JSON formatting only gets as far as the end of the red text. Also, a space gets introduced between https: and the rest of the URL.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1979931/21223090/4a59fb84-c2bd-11e6-93e3-a19d1c38a549.png)

Manually changing the // to a single / results in a completely red file and formatting then words, but there seems to be something wrong with the parsing.

data.title: Terminal AutoComplete does not access the contents of the folder
data.body:

data.title: Enhance Copy/Update action in Settings editor
data.body:
Current `edit` action has following issues

Moved the `edit` icon to the glyph margin making it consistent with our quick fix behavior. This helps in fixing layout issues with this icon. 

- [x] [Display the edit icon in settings with a small delay](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16802)
- [x] [dropdown decorator only works for first setting with multiple settings on a single line](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16458)
- [x] [action decoration in settings file makes it hard to put cursor at end of line](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16457)
- [x] [Settings: Edit icon off by a few pixels](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16698)
- [x] [Clicking edit icon in editable settings.json scrolls horizontally](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16714)
- [x] [New settings "copy to settings" drop down is clunky](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16711)
- [x] ["Copy to Settings" overwrites existing value](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16728)
- [x] ["edit" button for settings not discoverable](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16950)

data.title: Extension not updating after having it installed from the terminal using --install-Extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insiders
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I installed the eslint extension using the command line as described here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-eslint/issues/42#issuecomment-264828064. The vsix is in that comment as well.
2. Now I published a new version to the store with version number 1.2.1 expecting that the eslint will be updated to that version. However no update happens in the insider build into which I installed eslint using the command line.

data.title: CSS and HTML servers are breaking LSP
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.8.0
Commit 38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d
Date 2016-12-13T18:03:00.506Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
- OS Version: Fedora 25

With latest version 1.8 vscode language servers CSS and HTML (and maybe others) are using completion response structure that is invalid from language server protocol definition point of view.
Example CompletionItem:
```json
        {
            "label": "ion-view ",
            "kind": 10,
            "documentation": "Child of ionNavView. A container for view content and any navigational and header bar information.",
            "range": {
                "start": {
                    "line": 2,
                    "character": 1
                },
                "end": {
                    "line": 2,
                    "character": 5
                }
            }
        }
```
There is no such field like `range` in CompletionItem [1]. Response should contain `textEdit` field or language server protocol definition should be updated.

[1] https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md#completion-request

data.title: Code navigation in markdown edit mode
data.body:
It would be awesome if code can support code navigation on edit mode as well. So for instance, `cmd + click` on some of the links below will navigate to the appropriate section. Right now, code navigation is only supported in preview mode. 
```
## Table of Contents
* [Goals](#goals)
* [Non-Goals](#non-goals)
* [Overview](#overview)
```

|sublime-keybindings|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.20.4|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.12.2|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|1.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create PHP snippet:
```
{
	"CDN": {
		"prefix": "cdn",
		"body": [
			"$this->cdn($1)$2"
		],
		"description": "Insert a view->cdn method call."
	}
}
```
2. Open a PHP file and run the snippet. Output is `this->cdn()`  with "this" selected. Should output `$this->cdn()` with caret within the cdn call.

data.title: Feature Request: Auto hiding tabs
data.body: Would be amazing if there was an option to hide tabs and show them on mouse hover

data.title: error stack is undefined when my extension is activated
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
Version 1.8.0
Commit 38746938a4ab94f2f57d9e1309c51fd6fb37553d
Date 2016-12-13T18:03:00.506Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. checkout https://github.com/capaj/vscode-exports-autocomplete/tree/vs-code-activation-issue
2. install npm deps with yarn or npm
2. run in debug mode

output:
```
Activating extension `capaj.vscode-exports-autocomplete` failed: {1}.
Activating extension `capaj.vscode-exports-autocomplete` failed:  undefined
Here is the error stack:  undefined
```

It really isn't that helpful to print out undefined. I realized that my problem is, I am requiring a package `babel-traverse` which is not in node_modules because I did not specify it in package.json. It would be helpful if these kind of errors were properly shown to the user.
